info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 20 at 11:29AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM CDT FOR CLINTON COUNTY IN SOUTH CENTRAL ILLINOIS...SOUTHEASTERN MADISON COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS...NORTHERN WASHINGTON COUNTY IN SOUTH CENTRAL ILLINOIS AND NORTHEASTERN ST. CLAIR COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS... At 1128 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Wamac to 7 miles south of Beckemeyer to near Lebanon, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... O`Fallon, Edwardsville, Glen Carbon, Shiloh, Troy, Maryville, Mascoutah, Breese, Lebanon, New Baden, Carlyle, Nashville, Scott AFB, Centralia, Trenton, Aviston, Okawville, St. Rose, Germantown, and Albers. This also includes Carlyle Lake Recreational Area. This includes Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 19 and 61. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
